Class LanguageTree

java.lang.Object
  LanguageTree

public class LanguageTree
extends java.lang.Object

Two instances of the LanguageTree class are created, one for the English binary tree and one for the German binary tree. Both are used to manipulate tens of thousands of their own TreeNode objects; one for each word in the dictionary text files. This is an efficient data structure to use when searching through tens of thousands of objects because it only requires at most two dozen searches to find the word.

Author:
Sam Glendenning, Will Lockett, Danyal Ali

                      java.lang.String engWord,
                      java.lang.String gerWord)
Built by WL Adds a new node to the tree

Parameters:
id - The unique id of the english word
engWord - The english word
gerWord - The germal translation of the english word

findNode

public java.lang.String findNode(float find,
                                 int language)
Built by DA Method for finding the translation of the word we already have. Contains a while loop that runs until the word is found or we reach the place where the word should be and it is not there.

Parameters:
find - - the ID number of the word being searched for
language - - an integer value of 1 or 2, used to determine which language of the word we wish to extract
Returns:
the translation of the word we already have

getHighestLeft

public TreeNode getHighestLeft(TreeNode subRoot)
Built by SG Used to return the node with the largest ID on the left hand side of the tree, used to set a new root when the old root is being deleted

Parameters:
subRoot - - the root of the subtree currently being evaluated
Returns:
getHighestLeft - the node with the highest value of ID

getSmallestRight

public TreeNode getSmallestRight(TreeNode subRoot)
Built by SG Used to return the node with the smallest ID on the right hand side of the tree, used to set a new root when the old root is being deleted

Parameters:
subRoot - - the root of the subtree currently being evaluated
Returns:
smallestRightNode - the node with the lowest value of ID

removeFromTree

public void removeFromTree(TreeNode subRoot,
                           float searchID)
Built by SG Used to remove a node from the tree. Recursively called if the node is not found in the subroot or its children. Method is recalled with either the left or the right child as the new subRoot depending on which side of the tree is being traversed.

Parameters:
subRoot - - the root of the subtree currently being evaluated. Starts as the root of the tree, and changes as the program traverses left and right
searchID - - the ID of the node the user wants to delete

setRoot

public void setRoot(TreeNode newRoot)
Built by SG Used to set the root of the tree to a new node.

Parameters:
newRoot - - the TreeNode object to become the new root
